content.description:
This is a forced eliminate of Malevolent Eye when it is wet, a rather common occurrence. It's a really nice choice even when ME is dry! 

  If ME is really wet, use left start to ME -- the center hold off the ground could be unusable. Use the first two holds of ME past the start (positive edges), then begin eliminate. First new hold is small dish adjacent to very good ME hold. Second is bad crimp out left with some crystals for friction. Third is horrible small sloper adjecent to next wet ME hold. Fourth is small but positive crimp out left. Then rejoin ME at large sloper below hand-sized horizontal. Leave ME again out left before rejoining in a few moves. Crimp ladder is exhausting and tenuous crux.
content.protection: TR off tree, same as ME.
content.location: Start to left of ME on jugs.

content.description:
Fun traverse that follows the ground line, desgined to be able to be climbed with only one crashpad.   Approximately 30-40 feet on good holds with two distinct cruxes, the second one being height dependent. 

  Start on the beginning of standard route , climb up approx 3-4 of feet and traverse left on good holds. Once you reach the end of the good holds down climb a foot or so and try to get through the balancey first crux on the slopers out left. Top hold can be wet sometimes so its worth cleaning/ throwing some chalk on it before hand. 

  Continue past the 1st crux and head up and left until you end up around on a a pair of good holds 4-6 feet left of the massive jutting jug above the corner. Fire through the big move to a surprisingly good lip , continue up and top out.
content.protection: crash pad , I would personally put it under the 2nd crux/ topout
content.location: starts on the beginning of standard route, check picture for more detail.

content.description: Start at the prominent right facing flake 20 feet right of the ledge. Climb the flake, diagonal up left to good horizontal holds, then work back right to a left facing flake and continue directly to the top.

Start at the low sidepull near the rock sticking out from the rest, and pull to an alright pinch/full crimp. Get a high left foot on the rock behind the rock sticking out. Reach up to the first pocket with the left hand, then the second pocket with the right hand. Finish not at topout, but instead at the highest low ledge.
content.location: All the way on the right of the 50 footer face.

content.description: On the face below and slightly left of the first prominent black water streak, 3-4 feet right of the Standard Route flake. Work up the face just left of the water streak to the top.
On the face 3 feet right on the ledge. Climb straight up to the top staying just right of a faint black water streak.

Two starting hands visibly chalked up, go up with a solid left hand roughly two feet up from the starting holds. Traverse to the right about 4 feet (first zig zag), then go up about two more feet with your right hand. The crux is towards the top, which starts off the second zig zag. Hit the crux with your left hand and traverse to the left roughly six feet. The last move is about a foot above that.
content.protection: Two trees at the top for an anchor.
content.location: Roughly 20 or 30 feet to the right of "Standard Route". The starting hands are pretty much in the middle of the cave like structure.

content.description: Move up on small holds and a sharp crimp and make a long move up and right (crux) to a solid, left-facing point. Continue up on lesser-quality rock to a large ledge, then finish with a final 5 feet to a tree.
content.protection: Top rope off a large tree.
content.location: The obvious black streak 20 feet right of Malevolent Eye. Tall folks can reach a good start hold up left.

content.description: PM with details or post comment and I will update.
